Pre-Game Insights: When the Cincinnati Reds and Minnesota Twins go head to head in Saturday's 7:10 p.m. ET contest, how will the Twins' hitters perform against starter Nick Martinez?
The Reds' Martinez (8-6) will make his 14th start of the season.
The right-hander allowed two hits in seven scoreless innings pitched against the Atlanta Braves on Monday.
The 34-year-old has pitched in 39 games this season with an ERA of 3.46 and 7.2 strikeouts per nine innings, with an opponent batting average of .249.
In 13 starts this season, he's earned a quality start in three of them.
Martinez has pitched five or more innings in three straight games and will look to extend that streak.
He has made 39 appearances and finished 21 of them without allowing an earned run.
